Title: FRANCISCO VALDES,
Data:
Republic of the Philippines
SUPREME COURT
Manila


FIRST DIVISION 


G.R. No. L-44779	May 31, 1977


FRANCISCO VALDES, 
petitioner,

vs.


HONORABLE COURT OF APPEALS and HEALTH SERVICE CORPORATION, 
respondents.
 


R E S O L U T I O N 


 


MAKASIAR, 
J.:


On May 17, 1977, the parties, assisted by their respective counsel, filed the following motion to dismiss dated May 3, 1977: 






COME NOW the parties in the above entitled case and to this Honorable Supreme Court respectfully move that the above entitled case be dismissed as they have fully settled their differences amicably and further declare that they have no claim against each other either pecuniary or otherwise and further declare that they release one another from any and all kinds of liability whatsoever. 










Manila, May 3, 1977. 




 






 




Respectfully submitted, 






HEALTH SERVICE 




FRANCISCO VALDES, ET AL. 






CORPORATION 




Petitioners 






Private Respondent 




 






 




 






By:




By: 






(SGD.) ESTRELLA G. VILLASENOR




BANK OF THE PHILIPPINE 






Administrator




ISLANDS 






 




(In its capacity as guardian/






 




attorney in fact of Francisco 






 




Valdes, et al.) 






 




 






 




(SGD.) BENITO R. ARANETA 






 




Vice- President 






 




 






 




(SGD.) ROLANDO V. AROMIN 






 




Senior Asst. Trust Officer 






 




 






ASSISTED BY: 




ASSISTED BY: 






(SGD.) REYNALDO C. PATAWARAN 




ARANDA LAW OFFICE 






Counsel for Private




By: 






Respondent




 






Suite 503 Puzon Bldg.




(SGD.) ANTONIO K. ARANDA 






E. Rodriguez Sr. Blvd.




Counsel for Petitioners






Quezon City




Mezzanine Floor, Bank of P.I. Bldg. 






 




Plaza Cervantes, Manila 








WHEREFORE, THE PARTIES ARE HEREBY DIRECTED TO ABIDE BY THE TERMS OF THE FOREGOING MOTION TO DISMISS AND THIS CASE IS HEREBY DISMISSED AND TERMINATED, WITHOUT COSTS. 


Teehankee (Chairman), Antonio, Muñoz-Palma and Martin, JJ., concur. 


Antonio J., was designated to sit in the First Division.
